001import javax.swing.BoxLayout;
002import javax.swing.ImageIcon;
003import javax.swing.JButton;
004import javax.swing.JFrame;
005import javax.swing.JLabel;
006import javax.swing.JPanel;
007import javax.swing.JScrollPane;
008import javax.swing.JTextArea;
009import javax.swing.JTextField;
010
011import java.awt.BorderLayout;
012import java.awt.Dimension;
013import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
014import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
015import java.awt.event.WindowAdapter;
016import java.awt.event.WindowEvent;
017
018import java.net.URL;
019import java.util.Arrays;
020
021/**
022 * This class implements a simple graphical user interface with a 
023 * text entry area, a text output area and an optional image.
024 * 
025 * @author Michael Kolling
026 * @version 1.0 (Jan 2003) DB edited (2023)
027 */
028public class UserInterface implements ActionListener
029{
030    /**un moteur de jeu qui gere la fonctionnalite du jeu*/
031    private GameEngine aEngine;
032    /**la fenetre principale de l'interface*/
033    private JFrame     aMyFrame;
034    /**la zone de texte pour l'entree de l'utilisateur*/
035    private JTextField aEntryField;
036    /**la zone de texte pour la sortie du programme*/
037    private JTextArea  aLog;
038    /**permet d'afficher une image*/
039    private JLabel     aImage;
040    /**un tableau de boutons pour les directions*/
041    private JButton[]   aBtsGo;
042    /**un tableau contenant les directions possibles*/
043    private String[] vDirections = {"North", "South", "West", "East", "Up", "Down"};
044
045    /**
046     * Construct a UserInterface. As a parameter, a Game Engine
047     * (an object processing and executing the game commands) is needed.
048     * @param pGameEngine  The GameEngine object implementing the game logic.
049     */
050    public UserInterface( final GameEngine pGameEngine )
051    {
052        this.aEngine = pGameEngine;
053        this.createGUI();
054    } // UserInterface(.)
055
056    /**
057     * Print out some text into the text area.
058     * @param pText The text to print.
059     */
060    public void print( final String pText )
061    {
062        this.aLog.append( pText );
063        this.aLog.setCaretPosition( this.aLog.getDocument().getLength() );
064    } // print(.)
065
066    /**
067     * Print out some text into the text area, followed by a line break.
068     * @param pText The text to print.
069     */
070    public void println( final String pText )
071    {
072        this.print( pText + "\n" );
073    } // println(.)
074
075    /**
076     * Show an image file in the interface.
077     * @param pImageName The name of the image file to display.
078     */
079    public void showImage( final String pImageName )
080    {
081        String vImagePath = "Images/" + pImageName; // to change the directory
082        URL vImageURL = this.getClass().getClassLoader().getResource( vImagePath );
083        if ( vImageURL == null )
084            System.out.println( "Image not found : " + vImagePath );
085        else {
086            ImageIcon vIcon = new ImageIcon( vImageURL );
087            this.aImage.setIcon( vIcon );
088            this.aMyFrame.pack();
089        }
090    } // showImage(.)
091
092    /**
093     * Enable or disable input in the entry field.
094     * @param pOnOff true to enable, false to disable.
095     */
096    public void enable( final boolean pOnOff )
097    {
098        this.aEntryField.setEditable( pOnOff ); // enable/disable
099        if ( pOnOff ) { // enable
100            this.aEntryField.getCaret().setBlinkRate( 500 ); // cursor blink
101            this.aEntryField.addActionListener( this ); // reacts to entry
102        }
103        else { // disable
104            this.aEntryField.getCaret().setBlinkRate( 0 ); // cursor won't blink
105            this.aEntryField.removeActionListener( this ); // won't react to entry
106            for (int i = 0; i < vDirections.length; i++) {
107                aBtsGo[i].removeActionListener(this);
108            }
109        }
110    } // enable(.)
111
112    /**
113     * Set up graphical user interface.
114     */
115    private void createGUI()
116    {
117        this.aMyFrame = new JFrame( "Le Secret du Chat" ); // change the title !
118        this.aEntryField = new JTextField( 34 );
119
120        this.aLog = new JTextArea();
121        this.aLog.setEditable( false );
122        JScrollPane vListScroller = new JScrollPane( this.aLog );
123        vListScroller.setPreferredSize( new Dimension(200, 200) );
124        vListScroller.setMinimumSize( new Dimension(100,100) );
125
126        this.aImage = new JLabel();
127
128        JPanel vEastPanel = new JPanel();// ==> place buttons add
129        vEastPanel.setLayout(new BoxLayout(vEastPanel, BoxLayout.Y_AXIS));//BoxLayout vertical
130        
131        this.aBtsGo = new JButton[vDirections.length];
132        for (int i = 0; i < vDirections.length; i++) {
133            aBtsGo[i] = new JButton(vDirections[i]);
134            vEastPanel.add(aBtsGo[i]);
135            aBtsGo[i].addActionListener(this);
136        }
137
138        JPanel vPanel = new JPanel();
139        vPanel.setLayout( new BorderLayout() ); // ==> only five places
140        vPanel.add( this.aImage, BorderLayout.NORTH );
141        vPanel.add( vListScroller, BorderLayout.CENTER );
142        vPanel.add( this.aEntryField, BorderLayout.SOUTH );
143        vPanel.add( vEastPanel, BorderLayout.EAST );
144
145        this.aMyFrame.getContentPane().add( vPanel, BorderLayout.CENTER );
146
147        // add some event listeners to some components
148        this.aEntryField.addActionListener( this );
149
150        // to end program when window is closed
151        this.aMyFrame.addWindowListener(
152            new WindowAdapter() { // anonymous class
153                @Override public void windowClosing(final WindowEvent pE)
154                {
155                    System.exit(0);
156                }
157        } );
158
159        this.aMyFrame.pack();
160        this.aMyFrame.setVisible( true );
161        this.aEntryField.requestFocus();
162    } // createGUI()
163
164    /**
165     * Actionlistener interface for entry textfield.
166     */
167    @Override public void actionPerformed( final ActionEvent pE ) 
168    {
169        // no need to check the type of action at the moment
170        // because there is only one possible action (text input) :
171        String vBtnName = pE.getActionCommand();
172        if (Arrays.asList(vDirections).contains(vBtnName)) {
173            this.aEngine.interpretCommand("go " + vBtnName.toLowerCase());
174        }else this.processCommand(); // never suppress this line
175    } // actionPerformed(.)
176
177    /**
178     * A command has been entered in the entry field.  
179     * Read the command and do whatever is necessary to process it.
180     */
181    private void processCommand()
182    {
183        String vInput = this.aEntryField.getText();
184        this.aEntryField.setText( "" );
185
186        this.aEngine.interpretCommand( vInput );
187    } // processCommand()
188} // UserInterface
